forumNotes.author: aryan_ai
forumNotes.content:
Hello, I am working in dual boot stuff between FreeDOS and WinPE 2.0. Could some one guide me on how to boot from FreeDOS to winPE 1) From WinPE- I am able to switch to FreedOS after doing the steps below a) modifying the entries in the BCD (to boot as WinPE) file using BcdEDIT ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) run the command C:\\bootsect.exe /nt52 C: /Force c) reboot the machine, After reboot machine is switching to FreeDOS 2) From FreeDOS - Could some guide me on how to switch from FreeDOS to WinPE I can't run bootsect.exe from FreeDOS. so tell me the alternate way to swtich to WinPE.
let me know If I need to provide more information. Thanks in advance Aryan

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
The easiest way is using Grub4Dos to launch WinPE straight from within Freedos without need to reboot.
We support grub4dos with a dedicated subforum section, look it up on the site tree and see the member posted topics to see how it can be used. The documentation is also very easy to follow. Good luck! ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: aryan_ai
forumNotes.content:
Nuno - Thanks for your quick response to my e-mail. I am able to switch between FreeDOS and WinPE now without grub4dos. My machine hard disk is loaded with both WinPE and FreeDOS 1) Captured primary partition (C:) boot sector to and kept at C:\\BOOTSECT.DOS 2) then modified the bootsector C:\\bootsect.exe /nt60 C: /Force (this is for WinPE) 3) Copied all the required files BCD, boot.ini, NTLDR etc... to C drive 4) Modified BCD file such that boot menu gives option for both WinPE after reboot Now I am able to switch between FREEDOS and WinPE based on boot menu selection :-) However my next thing is boot from USB instead of Hard disk i.e USB will have files required for both FreeDOS and WinPE To implement this ,First USB should be bootable on FAT32 with FreeDOS. I am able make USB bootable with FAT16 only having FreeDOS in it but I need to boot from FAT32. Can some one guide me on how to boot FAT32 with FreeDOS in it.
Thanks Aryan

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Booting FreeDOS on USB FAT32 can in some cases be tricky.  

The actual reason is yet not clearly found.  

Through grub4dos (installing the grldr.mbr) there should be better chances (search on the board, there is a report by **ktp** about FAT32 booting problems solved), but since you seem to not want using it, you can try using makebootfat.  

Read this thread **and** links therein:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5206](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=5206 "External link")  

jaclaz
